pros: People are kind, very great environment!
cons: A little bit busy for the day shift.

pros: Offer STD & LTD, 401k match and decent parking.
cons: Not friendly towards anyone with a family Small community hospital, some people have been here for 20+ years and there is no oversight. Rules are applied sporadically and menacingly. HR is a joke - they practice illegal FMLA protocols.

pros: Great friendly coworkers and flexible schedules
cons: Horrible management they target employees who question anything

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Good team mentality, higher ups care about you more than most hospitals in Pittsburgh, free food sometimes for staff, self schedule stays pretty much the same as what you choose, quality physicians to work with
cons: Upmc still controls the market in Pittsburgh so we’re still not getting paid enough, differentials for nightshift and weekends are only like 1$

review_title: Isn’t what it used to be
job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Flexible hours for casual staff
cons: It is always short and no matter how many nurses we are short we still get the same patient load

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Out of the city, free on-site and covered parking, no traffic
cons: Very poor management and leadership, offers no support to staff, only criticisms. HR does nothing to support or mediate complaints or issues. I filed a harassment complaint and it was never even investigated

pros: Good Benefits and family oriented
cons: No cons has been a good experience

review_title: nice place to work, nice people
pros: nice place to work, local, cheap parking, easy to get to don't have to deal with downtown traffic.
cons: They are not competitive with the wages any more.

pros: Coworkers support each other most of the time
cons: Difficult to schedule time off

job_title: Vice President Facilities and Engineering in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Culture, people, structure, location, leadership
cons: Pay, challenges, micro management, accountability,

job_title: Surgical Technologist in Mount Lebanon, PA
pros: Clean hospital, nice area of Pittsburgh, free parking
cons: You will be lied to about so much.

pros: Staff is wonderful and welcoming
cons: Management is awful and doesn't care about the staff

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Location is the primary reason why I have worked there for many years.
cons: They build a new building and expect the staff to cover both the hospital and health center.

review_title: Not great but not the worst

pros: Good pay, good coworkers, clean facility
cons: Lack of staff every shift

job_title: Physician Practice Manager in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: The doctors are fantastic to work with!
cons: Leadership of the physician network does not listen to their people. Middle management is never provided enough tools / resources to assist their people. Everyone is underpaid.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: great health benefits and pleasant environment
cons: pay scale is low and they are lacking middle management

job_title: Patient Transporter in Mount Lebanon, PA
pros: People in all the departments are very friendly and helpful.
cons: Hard job dealing with patients who do not feel well.

pros: Free parking, smaller hospital so it has a closer knit feel
cons: HR is incredibly inefficient, they are outdated with many of their views and the way they serve the community. NO advancement

pros: Small community feel, free parking
cons: Short staffed on many of the units

review_title: Collaborative and supportive nursing environment, poor professional growth potential
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Supportive peers, autonomy within the unit, community hospital with strong reputation
cons: Pay below local standards, No university affiliation and not up to date with best practice standards, limited to no opportunities for growth or professional development beyond bedside nursing. Human Resources department is not transparent and will support all administrative decisions.

job_title: Physical Therapy Aide in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Coworkers are good and friendly.
cons: Nothing to report at this moment.

pros: Great benefits and that's about it
cons: Missed managed no onboard at offices and low pay

pros: Great team at the hospital
cons: The hospital is kind of small

job_title: Psychiatric Charge & Staff RN in Wayne, NJ
pros: Most of the staff was a pleasure to work with.  I believe they worked hard to get patient to a functioning status and cared about what happened to these clients when they left.  The pay was also very good.
cons: Somewhere along the way I got on the wrong side of the supervisor, and she was on me for my performance, but everytime they sent me home to investigate, nothing came of it.  I always got very good reviews, but she began to imply that I was not competent, even though I always got my work done on time, I never had any issues with the clients

review_title: Medical Technologist, Generalist - higher pay is also higher frustration, don’t let that bonus tempt you
pros: Decent pay, benefits, retirement matching, cafeteria and cafe with GOOD food, coworkers who are mostly friendly and who usually have good attitudes toward work, free parking, overtime available from never being fully staffed, outside of most city traffic, for-profit hospital with money to spend
cons: Ineffective training, high turnover, critical management who lacks compassion, communication, leadership and progressive vision, “on-call” for call-offs and expected to work overtime, unorganized resources, “for-profit hospital” who formed originally from community donations now over-charges that community for services

pros: Friendly co-workers. Relaxed work environment. Good pay.
cons: Very difficult to get a FT daylight position. Little to no room for advancement. Management isn't easy to work with. Management shows favoritism, as Im sure does everywhere. Been working FT hours and more, for 8+ yrs without being offered, and always passed up for FT positions.

pros: Primary focus is to the patient, community with the employee as a close third.
cons: With reimbursement cuts to hospitals and physicians the employee need to take on additional responsibility and there is not enough time in the day to complete everything

pros: Most of the people you work with are very kind and work well as a tem. The Emergency Department was the best place to be, oportunity for advancement is very satisfactory
cons: Need better supervisors who don't play favorites

review_title: Definitely best hospital to work for outside of Pittsburgh
job_title: Registered Nurse in Upper Saint Clair, PA
pros: Very clean facility with great safety ratings. Lots of resources and classes offered. Good pay with two yearly raises. Brand new free employee parking garage. Brand new cafeteria and the food is actually pretty good.
cons: Extremely hard to get steady daylight. Particular managers can be hard to work with at times.

pros: Decent pay, location is a plus, benefits are ok, small hospital, free employee parking and paid parking isn't that bad compared to city hospitals
cons: Management doesn't care about employees- only $, over worked and mandated. Understaffed and don't care. Don't care if you have a life and family life outside work. "Don't like ir- you can leave and be replaced" attitude

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Friendly caring staff, great teamwork, would have considered staying but was offered a position elsewhere as soon as I was licensed to practice
cons: No major challenges encountered here, occasional unfriendly coworker, but the VAST majority of staff members were friendly and extremely easy to get along with

pros: Great community hospital that is growing.  People from the departments get to know you. Or at least smile and always say Hello when passing you by in the hallway.  Sometimes it feels like a family-type group of hard working employees.
cons: Overtime, not a great work-life balance.

pros: Nice suburban hospital in the South Hills of Pittsburgh.  Friendly co-workers.
cons: Management is out of touch with demands placed on employee's. Many are working double and triple shifts, for weeks on end, without a day off.  Also, some employees are  not given their entitled breaks for meals and bathroom because of what department they are in.

pros: Community hospital, great coworkers, yearly raises (although not very much)
cons: management doesn't care about employees, pays less than city hospitals, benefit plans basically force you to use st. clair services, constantly work short staffed

job_title: Psychiatric Charge & Staff RN in Wayne, NJ
pros: Most of the people are great to work with,
cons: They were just taken over by prime health care, so I do not know what changes have happened

pros: Great experience learned a whole lot of new things, people who worked in that department were very helpful.
cons: I personally couldn't do to much because I was an intern.

review_title: A Great Place to Work or be a Patient.
pros: Teamwork among departments. Supportive management. Clean environment. Responsive Medical Staff.
cons: Short staffed. Not many cons.

pros: Good people/work environment. Great Experience in a Hospital if wanting to pursue a Hospital job.
cons: Tiring, long distance walked everyday. Not enough employee appreciation.

pros: always on the move. not a dull moment. work with great people.
